Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no new taxes have been levied on motorcycles and rickshaws, as confirmed by the Federal Board of Revenue (FBR).
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the increase in registration fees for motorcycles and rickshaws, stating a rise of over 1,100 percent when there is no such increase.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misinterpreting the news report and misleading users into believing that the new taxes have already been introduced.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading Facebook post and comments from users who mistakenly believe the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the taxes mentioned in the news report will be implemented, even though the FBR has denied any plans to introduce such taxes.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
